title: Teaching
text:
As a graduate teaching assistant at OSU, I’ve taught labs and developed course materials for several of the applied classes our department offers. So far, these include

ST 351 - INTRODUCTION TO STATISTICAL METHODS I
ST 352 - INTRODUCTION TO STATISTICAL METHODS II
ST 511 - METHODS OF DATA ANALYSIS I
ST 512 - METHODS OF DATA ANALYSIS II
ST 509 - CONSULTING PRACTICUM

Since Fall of 2023, I’ve been applying my knowledge as a Statistical Consultant for our department’s internal consulting service.

title: Miles Moran
text:
Miles Moran
PhD Student / Consultant / TA
Oregon State University





Biography
I’m a statistician by trade, currently pursuing a PhD and Oregon State University. Under the supervision of Rob Trangucci and Lisa Madsen, our research involves the use of selection-model methodology to make spatio-temporal epidemiology models robust to MNAR data.
I work as a statistical consultant for OSU grad students, which has really fueled my passion for effective communication/education in statistics. Consulting is one of my responsibilities as the teaching assistant for our department’s consulting practicum course; but, I also get to advise other statisticians in their own consulting projects and develop course materials for them to use.
Although I like to clear my head by hiking or rock climbing, I spend a lot of my free time playing strategy games and building with LEGO.








Research Interests

Spatial/Spatio-Temporal Models
Extreme-Value Models
Statistics in Climate Science
Statistics in Epidemiology
Interactive Data Visualization






Education

PhD, Statistics (In Progress)
Oregon State University
MS, Statistics (2023)
Oregon State University
BS, Applied Mathematics (2020)
University of Nevada, Reno
